meanings.sent1: I will uncover the gift to see what's inside.
meanings.sent2: Please uncover the table before we eat dinner.
meanings.sent3: The magician will uncover the hidden rabbit in his hat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to uncover the joy in everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen eye helped him uncover the truth behind the mystery.

meanings.definition: To reveal or expose by removing a covering
meanings.sent1: The wind will uncover the buried treasure on the beach.
meanings.sent2: The journalist worked hard to uncover the corruption in the government.
meanings.sent3: The prankster decided to uncover his friend's surprise birthday party early.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to uncover the happiness hidden within her soul.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes helped uncover the beauty of the landscape.
